ADuCM302x Device Drivers API Reference Manual  Release 1.0.0.0
startup_ADuCM3027.h
1 
49 /*
50 ATTRIBUTE_INTERRUPT
51  If this is available for a compiler, flag that a function is an interrupt
52  function. This can allow a compiler do some special handling.
53 KEEP_VAR(var)
54  If this is available for a compiler, flag that "var" should NOT be
55  optimised away by the compiler even if the compiler thinks that it is not
56  used.
57 WEAK_PROTO(proto)
58  If this is available for a compiler, apply whatever attributes are needed
59  to a function prototype ("proto") to flag that the function is a "weak" one.
60 WEAK_FUNC(func)
61  If this is available for a compiler, apply whatever attributes are needed
62  to a function definition ("func") to flag that the function is a "weak" one.
63 VECTOR_SECTION
64  A particular setup may have a requirement that the vector table be placed
65  in a particular section. This specifies the name of that section
66 SECTION_PLACE(def,sectionname)
67  Place the "def" variable in the named section.
68 RESET_EXCPT_HNDLR
69  A particular setup may have a requirement for a different reset handler.
70  This specifies the name of that handler.
71 ALIGN_VAR
72  Align a variable to a specific alignment. Note that some compilers do this
73  using pragma which can't be included in a macro expansion.(IAR)
74 */
75 
76 #ifndef STARTUP_ADUCM3027_H
77 #define STARTUP_ADUCM3027_H

87 #ifdef __GNUC__
88 #define ATTRIBUTE_INTERRUPT __attribute__((__interrupt__))
89 #define KEEP_VAR(var) var __attribute__((used))
90 #define WEAK_PROTO(proto) __attribute__((weak)) proto
91 #define WEAK_FUNC(func) __attribute__((weak)) func
92 #define VECTOR_SECTION ".isr_vector"
93 #define SECTION_PLACE(def,sectionname) __attribute__ ((section(sectionname))) def
94 #define RESET_EXCPT_HNDLR ResetISR
95 #define COMPILER_NAME "GNUC"
96 #endif // __GNUC__
97 
98 #ifdef USER_SPECIFIED_RTOS
99 #include <user_rtos_support.h>
100 #endif
101 
102 #ifdef __ARMCC_VERSION
103 #define ATTRIBUTE_INTERRUPT
104 #define KEEP_VAR(var) var __attribute__((used))
105 #define WEAK_PROTO(proto) proto __attribute__((weak))
106 #define WEAK_FUNC(func) func
107 #define VECTOR_SECTION "RESET"
108 #define SECTION_PLACE(def,sectionname) __attribute__ ((section(sectionname))) def
109 #define RESET_EXCPT_HNDLR __main
110 #define COMPILER_NAME "ARMCC"
111 #endif // __ARMCC_VERSION
112 
113 #ifdef __ICCARM__
114 
115 /*
116 * Pm154 (rule 19.10): in the definition of a function-like macro, each instance
117 * of a parameter shall be enclosed in parentheses
118 * The parameters in the following macros cannot be enclosed in parentheses.
119 */
120 #pragma diag_suppress=Pm154
121 
122 #define ATTRIBUTE_INTERRUPT
123 #define KEEP_VAR(var) __root var
124 #define WEAK_PROTO(proto) __weak proto
125 #define WEAK_FUNC(func) __weak func
126 #define VECTOR_SECTION ".intvec"
127 #define SECTION_PLACE(def,sectionname) def @ sectionname
128 #define RESET_EXCPT_HNDLR __iar_program_start
129 #define COMPILER_NAME "ICCARM"
130 
131 #endif /* __ICCARM__ */

133 #define ADI_SRAM_RETENTION_SIZE_8K BITM_PMG_SRAMRET_BNK1EN
134 
135 #define ADI_SRAM_RETENTION_SIZE_16K BITM_PMG_SRAMRET_BNK2EN

138 /* ISRAM is enabled by default and can be disabled by below macro */
139 /*#define ADI_DISABLE_INSTRUCTION_SRAM */
140 
141 /* To enable the cache. Please note taht linker description file need to
142  have appropriate memeory mapping. */
143 /* #define ENABLE_CACHE */
144 
145 #if !defined(ATTRIBUTE_INTERRUPT) || !defined(KEEP_VAR) || !defined(WEAK_PROTO) || !defined(WEAK_FUNC) || !defined(VECTOR_SECTION) || !defined(SECTION_PLACE) || !defined(RESET_EXCPT_HNDLR)
146 #error "This compiler is not yet supported"
147 #endif
148 
149 /*
150  Local helpers for consistent ISR prototypes and implementations.
151 
152  The only Interrupts that should vector through the OSAL are the driver interrupts for which
153  ADI has provided drivers which can operate in both an RTOS and a non-RTOS context.
154 
155  When operating in an RTOS context interrupts are vectord from the NVIC controller
156  to a second level dispatch function known as the OSAL (operating system abstraction layer) dispatch.
157  The OSAL dispatch has common code that will interact with the RTOS.
158 
159  OSAL dispatched interrupts must pass their Interrupt ID (iid) to the common OSAL dispatch.
160 
161  System interrupts (Reset through SysTick) should never dispatch through the OSAL.
162 
163  The WEAK_PROTOTYPE and WEAK_FUNCTION macros are used for System interrupts handlers. These
164  handlers will always have a 'void' paramater list.
165 
166  The ADI_WEAK_PROTOTYPE and ADI_WEAK_PROTOTYPE macros will change the declaration of the Driver Interrupts Handlers
167  depending on whether or not they are operating in an RTOS context. In an RTOS context the IID (interrupy ID)
168  paramater and a driver specific 'void *' paramater are required. In a non-RTOS context there is no OSAL dispatch
169  and the paramater list is simply 'void'.
170 */
171 
172 #define WEAK_PROTOTYPE(x) WEAK_PROTO ( void x (void)) ATTRIBUTE_INTERRUPT ;
173 #define WEAK_FUNCTION(x) WEAK_FUNC ( void x (void)) { while(1){} }
174 
175 #if (ADI_CFG_ENABLE_RTOS_SUPPORT == 1)
176 #ifndef USER_SPECIFIED_RTOS
177 /* With a user-specified RTOS, user_rtos_support.h is expected to define these macros. */
178 #define ADI_WEAK_PROTOTYPE(x) WEAK_PROTO ( void x (uint32_t iid, void* handlerArg)) ATTRIBUTE_INTERRUPT ;
179 #define ADI_WEAK_FUNCTION(x) WEAK_FUNC ( void x (uint32_t iid, void* handlerArg)) { while(1) {} }
180 #endif
181 #else
182 #define ADI_WEAK_PROTOTYPE(x) WEAK_PROTO ( void x (void)) ATTRIBUTE_INTERRUPT ;
183 #define ADI_WEAK_FUNCTION(x) WEAK_FUNC ( void x (void)) { while(1) {} }
184 #endif
185

192 #endif
